channel.title: [python] Random Sentence generator
channel.description:
I got bored and decided to make a random sentence generator in python. Basically I give it a list of nouns, verbs, adjectives, and verb tenses to choose from, it picks on from each group randomly and combines them. Of course the sentence "Bob is run fast" wouldn't make any sense, so for the present verb tense, i want it too add the ending 'ing'. Problem is, it wont.
Ive tried getting it too choose from another list of verbs if the tense is present.
[code]import random #Declare nouns = ["Mary ","Bob ","Joe "]
adj = [" fast"," high"," quickly"]
past = "did" present = "is" future = "will"
tense = [past, present, future]
if tense == present: Verbs = [" running"," jumping", "jogging"] else: Verbs = [" run"," jump", "jog"]
sentence = random.choice(nouns) + random.choice(tense) + random.choice(Verbs) + random.choice(adj) print sentence [/code]
and tried to get it to add the ending its self. [code]import random #Declare nouns = ["Mary ","Bob ","Joe "]
Verbs = [" run"," jump", "jog"]
adj = [" fast"," high"," quickly"]
past = "did" present = "is" future = "will"
tense = [past, present, future]
if tense == present: Verbs + "ing"
sentence = random.choice(nouns) + random.choice(tense) + random.choice(Verbs) + random.choice(adj) print sentence [/code] They both don't add the ending. The first one still uses the " run"," jump", "jog" list.

item.title: [python] Random Sentence generator
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:6, topic:183087”][quote author=haticks link=topic=244778.msg2068589#msg2068589 date=1203574685]

[quote author=super_ link=topic=244778.msg2068535#msg2068535 date=1203573227]

I don’t know what your advice was, so no, i didn’t use it.
[/quote]using random(array) to get a random member
[/quote]I was already using random.choice() before you suggested that. So, no. My problem is, i can’t get it to change the item in the list.

Why not make it read nouns etc from a file ? Then make it print the contents of the file into a dict and then do random.choice() ?[/quote]It seemed pretty pointless at the time, with only 4 or so nouns.

Read full topic

item.title: [python] Random Sentence generator
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

I got bored and decided to make a random sentence generator in python. Basically I give it a list of nouns, verbs, adjectives, and verb tenses to choose from, it picks on from each group randomly and combines them. Of course the sentence “Bob is run fast” wouldn’t make any sense, so for the present verb tense, i want it too add the ending ‘ing’. Problem is, it wont.

Ive tried getting it too choose from another list of verbs if the tense is present.

[code]import random
#Declare
nouns = ["Mary ","Bob ","Joe "]

adj = [" fast"," high"," quickly"]

past = “did”
present = “is”
future = “will”

tense = [past, present, future]

if tense == present:
Verbs = [" running"," jumping", “jogging”]
else:
Verbs = [" run"," jump", “jog”]

sentence = random.choice(nouns) + random.choice(tense) + random.choice(Verbs) + random.choice(adj)
print sentence
[/code]

and tried to get it to add the ending its self.

[code]import random
#Declare
nouns = ["Mary ","Bob ","Joe "]

Verbs = [" run"," jump", “jog”]

adj = [" fast"," high"," quickly"]

past = “did”
present = “is”
future = “will”

tense = [past, present, future]

if tense == present:
Verbs + “ing”

sentence = random.choice(nouns) + random.choice(tense) + random.choice(Verbs) + random.choice(adj)
print sentence
[/code]
They both don’t add the ending. The first one still uses the " run"," jump", “jog” list.

Read full topic
